result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Chronic Neglect of a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tasha L. Bostwick

records.addlTxt:
3:27 PM/ RM 301.   Defendant Tasha L. Bostwick appeared by video, in custody in Taycheedah Correctional Institute via zoom.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. State notes status of counsel report and questions if Def. is aware of when she will be released from Taycheedah. Def. responds and will be released on Friday, Nov. 4th. State requests Adjourned Initial Appearance at a later date. State questions if Def. will be returning to Langlade County, Def. confirms. Court questions Def. residence upon return, Def. responds. Court would like to provide Def. with written notice for next hearing if possible and advises Def. of next court date, noting Def. should be present in courtroom. State notes bond has been set and requests it continue. Bond remains.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report
Adjourned initial appearance on October 31, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

3:09 PM Defendant Tasha L. Bostwick appeared by phone, in custody at Taycheedah.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Def. has yet to attain counsel and wishes to continue to wait. Court finds good cause and allows to go past time limits regarding Nhia Lee standards.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

3:16 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly L Hays in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def. is in prison, was to appear via Zoom but no appearance. Court will reschedule matter to July 18, 2022 at 1:30 p.m. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Recalled at 3:27 p.m. Def. now appears via Zoom from Taycheedah. Court reviews status of counsel. Def. still wishes to have counsel. Court makes record as to need for counsel and will reschedule for July 18 2022 at 1:30 p.m.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

03:09 PM Defendant Tasha L. Bostwick in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tasha L. Bostwick appeared by video means, via zoom.  Court review history of case. Def. wants to continue to wait for atty to be appointed. Court finds good cause to go past time limit for p.h. Bond continues. State has a note that def. may be going to treatment.  Def. is going to treatment.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

03:33 PM Defendant Tasha L. Bostwick in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tasha L. Bostwick appeared by video means. All parties via zoom. Counsel status report filed.  Def. would still like to wait for counsel. State notes def. is on a probation hold and a signature bond and def. has been offered treatment on ATR. CC is now satisfied.  CC gives Nhia Lee standards to def. and finds good cause. Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

03:15 PM Defendant Tasha L. Bostwick in court, in custody, via zoom.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tasha L. Bostwick appeared by video means. Court reviewed P.D. counsel report. Def. still wants counsel. Court notes def. has been in custody for a period of time and def. is allowed to have counsel and heard on p.h. rights and def. doesn't want to move forward with p.h. and finds good cause.  State informs def. is on a probation hold. Bond continues. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

03:25 PM Defendant Tasha L. Bostwick in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tasha L. Bostwick appeared by video means.  All parties via zoom.  Court reviews history of case. Def. will continue to wait for P.D.  Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report
Bail/Bond

No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with child victim.

02:44 PM Defendant Tasha L. Bostwick in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tasha L. Bostwick appeared by video means. All parties via zoom.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. is waiting on P.D. State will amend repeater statute.   State gives bail/bond recommendation. Def. is on probation hold.   Court orders $25,000 Signature bond with conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report
